task.title: Fix Reversed Lug Connections
task.shortdesc: Correct a potentiometer that operates backwards by swapping the outer lug connections.

prereq.p: You need a soldering iron heated to 650-700Â°F and desoldering wick or pump.

step.cmd: Desolder the wires from both outer lugs of the affected potentiometer.
step.info: Leave the center lug connection in place.

step.cmd: Solder the wires to the opposite outer lugs.
step.info: The wire that was on lug 1 now connects to lug 3, and the wire that was on lug 3 now connects to lug 1.

step.cmd: Test the potentiometer by turning the knob clockwise.
step.stepresult: Volume or tone should increase as you turn the knob clockwise.

result.p: The volume or tone now increases when you turn the knob clockwise.
